p: In summary, thirteen Echium species have been used as folk medicines across the endemic geographical distribution of Asia, Europe, and Macaronesia archipelagos. Among the plant parts, the roots are the most-used, followed by the aerial parts. Echium species exert sedative, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and anxiolytic pharmacological properties. As a result, these species are largely used to treat respiratory problems, ulcers, mental health ailments, and aid in wound healing ( Table 1).
